messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Over the last ten years, people have criticized big supermarkets for doing bad things. For example, they have wasted a lot of food and paid their suppliers too little money. They have also created too much plastic waste with their packaging. This has had a bad effect on our environment.

But now, supermarkets are starting to pay attention. Customers are very angry about the huge amount of plastic waste from packaging. Because of this, some of the biggest UK supermarkets have made a promise. They promised to change their packaging and reduce plastic waste.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. The text uses vocabulary above the B1 level. 'Criticized' (B2) and 'suppliers' (B2) are not B1 words and are not defined as keywords. This violates the vocabulary rule. The text is not immediately understandable by a B1 learner.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Over the last ten years, people have said that big supermarkets do bad things. For example, they have wasted a lot of food and paid the companies that provide their products too little money. They have also created too much plastic waste with their packaging. This has had a bad effect on our environment. But now, supermarkets are starting to pay attention. Customers are very angry about the huge amount of plastic waste from packaging. Because of this, some of the biggest UK supermarkets have made a promise. They promised to change their packaging and reduce plastic waste.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. The sentence 'For example, they have wasted a lot of food and paid the companies that provide their products too little money' is 21 words long. This exceeds the maximum sentence length of approximately 15 words. The sentence must be split to meet the B1 standard.

metadata.feedback_text: The text is a flawless example of B1 writing. It adheres strictly to all rules. Sentences are short and clear. Vocabulary is entirely within the A1-B1 range. The text is factually identical to the original. No corrections are needed.
